channel.title: Brew Jersey Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: Recorded somewhere on the Lanape Trail between Verona and Cedar Grove, your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss New Jersey microbrews.

image.title: Brew Jersey Podcast with Mike Auteri and Dave Fletcher

channel.itunes:author: Dave Fletcher, Michael Auteri
channel.itunes:keywords: beer, brewing, new jersey, cedar grove, verona, discussion, brewmaster
channel.itunes:subtitle: Recorded somewhere on the Lanape Trail between Verona and Cedar Grove, your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss, debate and sample New Jersey microbrews.
channel.description: Recorded somewhere on the Lanape Trail between Verona and Cedar Grove, your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss New Jersey microbrews.

item.title: Episode 9 - The Story of Hoboken Brewing (Part 2)
item.itunes:title: The Story of Hoboken Brewing (Part 2)
item.description:
We've been away for a winter nap and return with a triple-size episode!

We complete our fireside chat with Hoboken Brewing Company's Andrew Zebrowski and Brendan Drury by discussing crazy investors, branding and their business advice for other microbrewers. Also, Tony Forder Editor/President at Ale Street News delivers our second mighty installment of Ale Street News, featuring local brewing and brewery news.

Email us at: podcast@brewjersey.net

Facebook

Instagram
item.content:encoded:
We've been away for a winter nap and return with a triple-size episode!

We complete our fireside chat with Hoboken Brewing Company's Andrew Zebrowski and Brendan Drury by discussing crazy investors, branding and their business advice for other microbrewers. Also, Tony Forder Editor/President at Ale Street News delivers our second mighty installment of Ale Street News, featuring local brewing and brewery news.

Email us at: podcast@brewjersey.net

item.title: Episode 8 - The Story of Hoboken Brewing (Part 1)
item.itunes:title: The Story of Hoboken Brewing (Part 1)
item.description: Hoboken Brewing Company's Andrew Zebrowski and Brendan Drury started brewing beer in their garage and won several home brewing contests. They say that this inspired them to go bigger and start making beer professionally. Mike and Dave dig deeper into their story as they join us at the fire pit to tell us about the history of their friendship, why they started the company, and where they are headed. Also, Tony Forder Editor/President at Ale Street News delivers our first Ale Street News Report all the way from the Fifth Annual Rio De Cerveza Brew Fest.
item.content:encoded: Hoboken Brewing Company's Andrew Zebrowski and Brendan Drury started brewing beer in their garage and won several home brewing contests. They say that this inspired them to go bigger and start making beer professionally. Mike and Dave dig deeper into their story as they join us at the fire pit to tell us about the history of their friendship, why they started the company, and where they are headed. Also, Tony Forder Editor/President at Ale Street News delivers our first Ale Street News Report all the way from the Fifth Annual Rio De Cerveza Brew Fest.

item.title: Episode 7 - Yo, Ho, Ho, and a Bottle of Cold Spring Red
item.itunes:title: Yo, Ho, Ho, and a Bottle of Cold Spring Red
item.description: Dave travels to historic Cold Spring Brewery /Exit Zero in Cape May to sample a Cold Spring Red. On the way to the brewery, he passes through Cold Spring Village, a traditional village with a schoolhouse, blacksmith and a pirate festival. Dave tells Mike all about it. Hijinx and livations ensue.
item.content:encoded: Dave travels to historic Cold Spring Brewery /Exit Zero in Cape May to sample a Cold Spring Red. On the way to the brewery, he passes through Cold Spring Village, a traditional village with a schoolhouse, blacksmith and a pirate festival. Dave tells Mike all about it. Hijinx and livations ensue.
item.itunes:keywords: beer,microbrewery,new jersey,brewing,cold spring brewing,historic cold spring village,mark mcpherson,cold spring red,exit zero

item.title: Episode 6 - Yogi Beer
item.itunes:title: Yogi Beer
item.description: Mike and Dave enjoy the rage and fury of Alementary Brewing Co.'s weekly Yoga Fury event every Sunday at 11am at their brewing facility in Hackensack, NJ. Participants experience Yoga Fury with instructor Kurt Reineking and enjoy an excellent craft beer from The Alementary afterwards. Mike and Dave also gab with Tony Forder, one of the founders of Ale Street News and Chelsea Days from The Alementary. Hijinks ensue.
item.content:encoded: Mike and Dave enjoy the rage and fury of Alementary Brewing Co.'s weekly Yoga Fury event every Sunday at 11am at their brewing facility in Hackensack, NJ. Participants experience Yoga Fury with instructor Kurt Reineking and enjoy an excellent craft beer from The Alementary afterwards. Mike and Dave also gab with Tony Forder, one of the founders of Ale Street News and Chelsea Days from The Alementary. Hijinks ensue.
item.itunes:keywords: beer,microbrewery,new jersey,brewing,the alementary, hackensack, ale street news, kurt reineking, chelsea days, tony forder
item.itunes:subtitle: Mike and Dave enjoy the rage and fury of Alementary Brewing Co.'s weekly Yoga Fury event every Sunday at 11am at their brewing facility in Hackensack, NJ...
item.itunes:summary: Excitement and fun at The Alementary for Yoga Fury and beer with Kurt Reineking, Tony Forder and Chelsea Lancaster.
item.itunes:author: Dave Fletcher, Michael Auteri

item.title: Episode 5 - The Boonton Rock + Brew
item.itunes:title: The Boonton Rock + Brew
item.description: Mike and Dave discuss Dave's solo flight at the Boonton Rock & Brew beer festival. While there, Dave runs into Rick Reed, Founder of Cricket Hill Brewery, as well as Charlie from Cypress Brewing Company and Bill from Pinelands Brewing. Hijinks ensue.
item.content:encoded: Mike and Dave discuss Dave's solo flight at the Boonton Rock & Brew beer festival. While there, Dave runs into Rick Reed, Founder of Cricket Hill Brewery, as well as Charlie from Cypress Brewing Company and Bill from Pinelands Brewing. Hijinks ensue.
item.itunes:subtitle: ike and Dave discuss Dave's solo flight at the Boonton Rock & Brew beer festival. While there, Dave runs into Rick Reed, Founder of Cricket Hill, as well as Charlie from Cypress Brewing Company and Bill from Pinelands Brewing. Hijinks ensue...

item.itunes:author: Dave Fletcher, Michael Auteri

item.title: Episode 4 - Magnified Growlers
item.itunes:title: Magnified Growlers
item.description: For Mike's birthday, the lads try a growler of "Vine Shine IPA" from Magnify Brewing Company in Fairfield, NJ, Gary's and Bottle King in Wayne, discuss bringing your kids to a brewery, and wrap it up with the British translation of Growler and Fanny. Fun for nearly the whole family in this episode. Don't forget to wish Mike a Happy Birthday in the comments.
item.content:encoded: For Mike's birthday, the lads try a growler of "Vine Shine IPA" from Magnify Brewing Company in Fairfield, NJ, Gary's and Bottle King in Wayne, discuss bringing your kids to a brewery, and wrap it up with the British translation of Growler and Fanny. Fun for nearly the whole family in this episode. Don't forget to wish Mike a Happy Birthday in the comments.

item.title: Episode 3 - Homes Brewery + Ramstein Interview
item.itunes:title: Homes Brewery + Ramstein Interview
item.description: Mike and Dave try a growler of "Same Same Different" from Homes Brewery in Ann Arbor, MI. and then bring it back home with an exclusive interview with Greg Zaccardi, Founder of High Point Brewing in Butler, New Jersey from Oktoberfest in Montclair, NJ in Oct 2016.
item.content:encoded: Mike and Dave try a growler of "Same Same Different" from Homes Brewery in Ann Arbor, MI. and then bring it back home with an exclusive interview with Greg Zaccardi, Founder of High Point Brewing in Butler, New Jersey from Oktoberfest in Montclair, NJ in Oct 2016.

item.title: Episode 2 - KBS Madness in Essex
item.itunes:title: KBS Madness in Essex
item.description: Your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss the recent statewide frenzy over Founders KBS, NYC's Beer Authority, Rattle-n-Hum, and their first beer ever.
item.content:encoded: Your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss the recent statewide frenzy over Founders KBS, NYC's Beer Authority, Rattle-n-Hum, and their first beer ever.

item.title: Episode 1 - The Eye of the Stormy
item.itunes:title: The Eye of the Stormy
item.description: Your intrepid beermeisters, Michael Auteri and Dave Fletcher discuss the New Jersey microbrewery, Carton Brewery - and their fantastic Rum-Barrel-Aged Porter, Stormy.
